shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables dual-stream mode on the sending side.

dlentry.dd: Deprecated: Deprecated since v4.2.0. Use instead.

section.p:
Dual-stream refers to high-quality (high resolution, high frame rate) and low-quality (low resolution, low frame rate) video streams:
High-quality stream: High resolution and high frame rate video stream.
Low-quality stream: Low resolution and low frame rate video stream. After enabling dual-stream mode, you can call on the receiving side to choose whether to receive the high-quality or low-quality video stream.

ul.li: This method applies to all types of streams sent by the sender, including but not limited to camera-captured video, screen sharing, and custom captured video streams.
To enable dual-stream in multi-channel scenarios, call .
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable dual-stream mode.
: Enable dual-stream mode.
: (Default) Disable dual-stream mode.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
